title: Rework passwordless keystore imports
body:
## Description

Passwordless imported keystores is a rare validator client feature implemented by Lighthouse. My main issues with it is that it's too easy to trigger and that is provides a poor user experience especially to new Lighthouse users.

## Version

Lighthouse v4.2.0-c547a11 (stable)

## Present Behaviour

When using the `account validator import` command, it is easy and possible to omit entering a password leading to a passwordless imported keystore.

## Expected Behaviour

It should be hard for a new Lighthouse user to import a keystore without a password.

## Steps to resolve

There are many ways to solve this issue but here are 3 differents proposals:

1. Keep the passwordless imported keystore feature, but always require a password with the `account validator import` command. For advanced users, simply document how it's possible to manually add a passwordless keystore in the `validator_definitions.yml` file.
2. Keep the passwordless imported keystore feature, but always require a password with the `account validator import` command unless the `--enable-omitting-password` option is added to that command.
3. Keep the passwordless imported keystore feature, but require a password with the `account validator import` command when the `--disable-omitting-password` option is added to that command.

Each one of these proposals would be good to improve this use case. They are ordered in terms of preference to me.
